unnormalised: So, you’ve finally graduated? Congrats! Or as my nani would say, “*Aakhir kar liya!*” All those late nights fueled by chai and Maggi, cramming for exams… it was all worth it, right? Well, kinda. Remember that GPA? Yeah, the one that’s probably somewhere between a respectable 7.5 and a “*beta, Sharma ji ka beta*” worthy 9.8? Frame it! Seriously, get a fancy frame. It's proof you survived the Indian education system, a feat more impressive than summiting Everest.

unnormalised: Speaking of certificates, my cousin, bless his cotton socks, framed his participation certificate from a school drawing competition. Said it was “portfolio building.” Genius! So, dig out that inter-college debate win, that best project award (even if it was a slightly enhanced version of a Wikipedia entry) and give them their moment in the sun. After all, that “Certificate of Excellence in Basket Weaving” might just be the edge you need on LinkedIn. Or at least, it'll make for a good story at the next family gathering.

unnormalised: And what about those degrees themselves? A B.Tech from a Tier-3 college? An M.A. in something obscure? Own it! Remember that time you aced that particularly brutal thermodynamics exam after surviving on just instant noodles for a week? That's a story of resilience, my friend! Put it on your resume as "Master of Resourcefulness Under Extreme Pressure". It will look good... probably.

unnormalised: But seriously, the real value of those certificates and degrees? They’re a testament to your ability to learn, adapt, and survive on a diet that would make a pigeon jealous. They're proof you can handle pressure, deadlines, and the occasional existential crisis brought on by a particularly confusing professor. So, yeah, frame them, flaunt them, and maybe even use them as a coaster once in a while. Just don't lose the original. You’ll need it for the next verification process.
